suppress.notes: file name: Serilog.Sinks.Async.dll A vulnerability exists in Async through 3.2.1 (fixed in 3.2.2) , which could let a malicious user obtain privileges via the mapValues() method. This is a false positive as the vulnerability exists in a NPM Javascript package named 'Async' and not the nuget .NET package named 'Serilog.Sinks.Async'.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/176 for full MS Details on CVE. A remote code execution vulnerability exists when parsing certain types of graphics files. This vulnerability only exists on systems running on MacOS or Linux. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.405, ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/112 for full MS Details on the CVE A denial of service vulnerability exists when .NET Framework or .NET Core improperly handle web requests, aka '.Net Framework and .Net Core Denial of Service Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-0820, CVE-2019-0981. Vunerability applies to System.Private.Uri version 4.3.0 and 4.3.1. System.Private.Uri is part of the .NetCore runtime, and fixed with version System.Private.Uri version 4.3.2. ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/113 for full MS Details on the CVE Vunerability applies to System.Private.Uri version 4.3.0 and 4.3.1. System.Private.Uri is part of the .NetCore runtime, and fixed with version System.Private.Uri version 4.3.2. The issue is fixed: 2.1.11 or SDK 2.1.507 for Visual Studio 2017 or SDK 2.1.604 for Visual Studio 2019 2.2.5 or SDK 2.2.107 for Visual Studio 2017 or SDK 2.2.204 for Visual Studio 2019 ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/121 for full MS Details on CVE. A denial of service vulnerability exists when .NET Core improperly handles web requests. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause a denial of service against a .NET Core web application. The vulnerability can be exploited remotely, without authentication. This CVE applies to any .NET Core based application running on .NET Core 2.1.0-2.1.12, or .NET Core 2.2.0-2.2.6. ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll An information disclosure vulnerability exists in .NET Framework and .NET Core which allows bypassing Cross-origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configurations, aka ".NET Framework Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This applies to version of System.Net.Http as deployed as part of .Net core below 2.1.7 or 2.2.1. ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/111 for MS details on this CVE. Package name: System.Text.RegularExpressions.dll (included as part of the .Net Core runtime) Vulnerable versions: 4.3.0 and below Secure versions: 4.3.1+ This CVE applies to .Net Core versions below 2.2.107 (runtime 2.2.5). ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/97 for MS details on this CVE. This CVE only applies to .NetCore versions below 2.1.8 and 2.2.2. ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features.dll file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Extensions.dll file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebUtilities.dll See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8409 for details on this CVE. Note: This was reanalysed by NIST on 4th October, and is now a breaking issue. This is a temporary suppression pending a fix being available.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/175 for full MS Details on CVE. .NET Core and Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.405, ERP is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/194 for full MS Details on CVE. A denial of service vulnerability exists in .NET 5.0, .NET Core 3.1 and .NET Core 2.1 where .NET (Core) server applications providing WebSocket endpoints could be tricked into endlessly looping while trying to read a single WebSocket frame. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.412, ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll Suppressing this CVE as it is a .NetCore runtime issue affecting .NetCore runtimes below .NET Core 3.1.4 or lower. The ERP Facade Runs in an AppService which will have the fixes already applied, and the global.json has been addeded to require .NetCore SDK > 6.0.101 or greater. More details can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/156

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/aspnet/announcements/issues/316 for MS details on this CVE. If the highest .NET Core SDK version is less that 2.1.402 or the highest Microsoft.AspNetCore.App runtime version is less that 2.1.4 you are vulnerable to this issue This CVE applies to .Net Core versions below 2.1.402 (runtime 2.1.4). ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vulnerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/196 for full MS Details on CVE. An information disclosure vulnerability exists in .NET 5.0, .NET Core 3.1 and .NET Core 2.1 when dumps created by the tool to collect crash dumps and dumps on demand are created with global read permissions on Linux and macOS. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.412, ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: WindowsAzure.Storage:9.3.3 This CVE applies to .NET Core 2.1, .NET Core 1.0, .NET Core 1.1, PowerShell Core 6.0. ERP Facade is pinned to .Net core SDK > 6.0.101 for .NET and Visual Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. This is a temporary suppression pending a fix being available.
file name: Azure.Identity.dll file name: Azure.Identity:1.10.3
file name: Various Azure. Refers to Azure CLI.
file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll Fixed in .NET SDK 6.0.417
file name: dotnet-getdocument.dll Fixed in .NET SDK 6.0.417
file name: System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow:Various False positive - applies to Tasks.org Android app
file name: System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll False positive - applies to Tasks.org Android app
file name: System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions:Various False positive - applies to Tasks.org Android app
file name: System.Threading.Tasks.dll False positive - applies to Tasks.org Android app
file name: System.Threading.Tasks:Various False positive - applies to Tasks.org Android app
file name: Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.dll False positive - Newtonsoft.Json > 13.0.1 included in project
file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll Vunerability is related to a Dotnet tool function that is not used in the production code
